property.name: text
property.value: Constant containing a scalar token for its value

property.name: text
property.value: Constant containing a record token for its value, with a single sink

property.name: text
property.value:
Questions: 1) Some actors can output either a scalar token or a record token. How should the property resolution handle these?
- Should the lattice be changed to allow promoting e.g. a scalar property to a record property? With the current lattice this is not possible. If so what would the changes be?
- If not, how can we write a generic property adapter file to handle this situation, so we don't need special code every time to figure out if the actor is outputting a scalar token or record token?
- Should we allow an object to be assigned both a scalar property and a record property? (I.e. the record would have scalar properties for each field, but also a scalar property for the whole record.) If so how would this work?

property.name: text
property.value:
2) Field properties for parameters are not assigned (in fact, no parameter properties are assigned) and Special adapters are probably needed for certain actors (RecordAssembler, RecordDisassembler, SetVariable)
- How can we create property adapters that apply for all lattices?
3) Adding a field + field property to a RecordProperty
- Is this allowed? How to do this? Special actor desired? RecordUpdater?
- What does this mean for the property analysis? How should the lattice be structured?
4) Writing values and updating properties for only some fields Anything special needed here?
